intro: Torenia concolor, commonly known as the common torenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Linderniaceae and is characterized by its striking violet or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are borne in clusters at the tips of the stems. Torenia concolor is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
